text_blocks.text: LOK SABHA
BULLETIN – PART I
(Brief Record of Proceedings) ___

children.text: (Brief Record of Proceedings)

text_blocks.text: Friday, January 31, 2020/Magha 11, 1941(Saka)
No. 58
1.  National Anthem
The National Anthem was played.
2.  Affirmation

Shri  Atul  Kumar  Singh  alias  Atul  Rai,  member  representing  Ghosi  Parliamentary Constituency of Uttar Pradesh made affirmation in Hindi, signed  the Roll of Members and took his seat in the House.

children.text: Shri  Atul  Kumar  Singh  alias  Atul  Rai,  member  representing  Ghosi
Parliamentary Constituency of Uttar Pradesh made affirmation in Hindi, signed
the Roll of Members and took his seat in the House.

text_blocks.text: 3.  President’s Address – Laid on the Table
Secretary-General  laid  on  the  Table  a  copy  of  the  President’s  Address  (Hindi  and  English  versions)  to  both  the  Houses  of  Parliament  assembled  together on the 31  January, 2020.

children.text: Secretary-General  laid  on  the  Table  a  copy  of  the  President’s  Address
(Hindi  and  English  versions)  to  both  the  Houses  of  Parliament  assembled
together on the 31 st  January, 2020.
together on the 31
st
January, 2020.

text_blocks.text: 4. Papers laid on the Table
The Minister of Finance and Minister of Corporate Affairs (Smt. Nirmala  Sitharaman) laid on the Table:-

children.text: The Minister of Finance and Minister of Corporate Affairs (Smt. Nirmala
Sitharaman) laid on the Table:-

text_blocks.text: (1)   A  copy  (Hindi  and  English  versions)  of  the  Economic  Survey  2019-20  (Volume I and Volume II).

children.text: (1)   A  copy  (Hindi  and  English  versions)  of  the  Economic  Survey  2019-20
(Volume I and Volume II).

text_blocks.text: (2)  A copy of explanatory Statement (Hindi and English versions) showing  reasons  for  immediate  legislation  by  promulgation  of  the  Insolvency  and  Bankruptcy Code (Amendment) Ordinance, 2019 (No. 16 of 2019) under Rule  71(2) of Rules of Procedure and Conduct of Business in Lok Sabha.

children.text: (2)  A copy of explanatory Statement (Hindi and English versions) showing
reasons  for  immediate  legislation  by  promulgation  of  the  Insolvency  and
Bankruptcy Code (Amendment) Ordinance, 2019 (No. 16 of 2019) under Rule
71(2) of Rules of Procedure and Conduct of Business in Lok Sabha.

text_blocks.text: The  Minister  of  State  in  the  Ministry  of  Parliamentary  Affairs  and  Minster  of  State  in  the  Ministry  of  Heavy  Industries  and  Public  Enterprises  (Shri  Arjun  Ram  Meghwal)  laid  on  the  Table  a  copy  each  of  the  following  Ordinances  (Hindi  and  English  versions)  under  article  123  (2)  (a)  of  the  Constitution:-

children.text: The  Minister  of  State  in  the  Ministry  of  Parliamentary  Affairs  and
Minster  of  State  in  the  Ministry  of  Heavy  Industries  and  Public  Enterprises
(Shri  Arjun  Ram  Meghwal)  laid  on  the  Table  a  copy  each  of  the  following
Ordinances  (Hindi  and  English  versions)  under  article  123  (2)  (a)  of  the
Constitution:-

text_blocks.text: (1)  The Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (Amendment) Ordinance, 2019 (No.  16 of 2019) promulgated by the President on 28  December, 2019.

text_blocks.text: (2)  The  Mineral  Laws  (Amendment)  Ordinance,  2020  (No.  1  of  2020)  promulgated by the President on 10  January, 2020.

text_blocks.text: 5.  Message from Rajya Sabha

Secretary  General reported a  message  from  Rajya  Sabha  that  at  its  sitting  held  on  the  12   December,  2019,  Rajya  Sabha  passed  the  Constitution (Scheduled Tribes) Order (Amendment) Bill, 2019.

text_blocks.text: 6.  Bill as passed by Rajya Sabha – Laid on the Table
The Constitution (Scheduled Tribes) Order (Amendment) Bill, 2019
7.  Reports of Standing Committee on Defence
Shri  Brijendra  Singh  presented  the  following  Reports  (Hindi  and  English Versions) of the Standing Committee on Defence:-

children.text: Shri  Brijendra  Singh  presented  the  following  Reports  (Hindi  and
English Versions) of the Standing Committee on Defence:-

text_blocks.text: *(1)  First  Report  of  the  Standing  Committee  on  Defence  (17th  Lok  Sabha)  on  'Demands  for  Grants  of  the  Ministry  of  Defence  for  the  year  2019-20  on  General  Defence  Budget,  Border  Roads  Organisation,  Indian  Coast  Guard,  Military  Engineer  Services,  Directorate  General  Defence  Estates,  Defence  Public  Sector  Undertakings,  Canteen  Stores  Department,  Welfare  of                   Ex-Servicemen,  Ex-Servicemen  Contributory  Health  Scheme,  Defence Pensions and Sainik Schools(Demand No. 18 and 21)'.

text_blocks.text: 8.  Report  of  Standing  Committee  on  Health  and  Family  Welfare

text_blocks.text: (Lok Sabha adjourned till 11.00 A.M., Saturday, the 1 st  February, 2020.)
SNEHLATA SHRIVASTAVA                 Secretary General
